description: Comprehensive system for enchanted artifacts and their mechanical implementation in Fate Core Skyrim.

legendary_artifacts.description: Unique, named items of great power with significant story importance

enchanted_equipment.description: Standard magical items with various enchantments

artifacts_of_power.description: Items tied to specific quests or factions

enchantment_bonuses.minor_enchantment: +1 to specific skill or +1 damage/armor in specific situation
enchantment_bonuses.moderate_enchantment: +2 to specific skill or +1 damage/armor always, plus situational benefit
enchantment_bonuses.major_enchantment: +2 to skill or damage/armor, plus special ability (once per scene)
enchantment_bonuses.legendary_enchantment: +3 bonus, aspect creation, special abilities (multiple uses)

aspects_from_equipment.description: Enchanted items can create aspects that define them
examples: 'Blessed by Talos' on a holy amulet
aspects_from_equipment.usage: Can be invoked for +2 or reroll when aspect is relevant

legendary_artifacts.name: Wuuthrad
legendary_artifacts.description: A massive ancient Nordic battleaxe that has slain countless elves throughout history.

mechanical_stats.special_bonus: +3 additional vs. elves (High Elves, Wood Elves, Dark Elves)

special_ability.name: Ancient Fury
special_ability.effect: Once per session, invoke Ysgramor's wrath to automatically succeed on a Fight roll against elven opponent.

legendary_artifacts.requirements: Two-handed weapon skill, usually requires Companions Harbinger status
legendary_artifacts.lore_significance: Ysgramor used this weapon to drive elves from Skyrim in ancient times. Highly symbolic to Nords.
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Wielding Wuuthrad affects how elven NPCs react (fear, hatred) and how Nords view PC (respect, hero status)

legendary_artifacts.name: Mehrunes' Razor
legendary_artifacts.description: A wickedly sharp dagger with the power to kill instantly.

special_ability.name: Instant Kill
special_ability.effect: On successful attack with Mehrunes' Razor, spend 2 Fate Points to force target to immediately mark their highest available consequence. If no consequence available, target is taken out.
special_ability.limitation: Once per session, only works on living mortals (not daedra, undead, or constructs)

legendary_artifacts.corruption_risk: Daedric artifact. Extended use may draw Mehrunes Dagon's attention or corrupt wielder.
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Possession marks PC as someone who deals with Daedric Princes. Some NPCs fear or distrust this.

legendary_artifacts.name: The Staff of Magnus
legendary_artifacts.description: A powerful staff capable of absorbing magical energy.

special_ability.name: Absorb Magic
special_ability.effect: When targeted by magical attack, can use staff to absorb it. Spend 1 Fate Point to negate attack completely and gain 1 mental stress box recovery.

secondary_ability.name: Drain Magicka
secondary_ability.effect: Attack action targeting enemy spellcaster. On hit, target cannot cast spells next exchange.

legendary_artifacts.requirements: Lore skill, College of Winterhold membership usually required
legendary_artifacts.lore_significance: Central to controlling the Eye of Magnus. One of the most powerful magical artifacts in Tamriel.
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: College of Winterhold members show immense respect. Other mages covet this item.

legendary_artifacts.name: Auriel's Bow
legendary_artifacts.description: Ancient elven bow with the power of the sun.

special_ability.name: Sunhallowed Arrows
special_ability.effect: When using special sunhallowed arrows, create 'Sunburst' zone aspect. All undead in zone take +2 stress from all sources.
special_ability.limitation: Arrows must be blessed at Auriel's shrine

legendary_artifacts.requirements: Archery skill, typically requires Dawnguard questline
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Especially powerful against vampires and undead. Vampire NPCs fear this weapon.

legendary_artifacts.name: Savior's Hide
legendary_artifacts.description: A magical hide armor blessed by Hircine, providing magical and poison resistance.

mechanical_stats.special_bonus: +2 to defend against poison and disease, +1 to defend against magic

special_ability.name: Hunter's Endurance
special_ability.effect: Once per session, can automatically shake off one mild or moderate consequence related to poison, disease, or magic.

legendary_artifacts.lycanthropy_synergy: If PC is werewolf, provides +1 additional bonus while in beast form
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Mark of Hircine's favor. Hunters and werewolves respect this.

legendary_artifacts.name: Ring of Hircine
legendary_artifacts.location: Ill Met by Moonlight quest (spare Sinding)
legendary_artifacts.description: A Daedric ring that grants its wearer greater control over lycanthropy, allowing transformation at will.

special_ability.name: Master the Beast
special_ability.effect: If the wearer is a lycanthrope, they can transform into beast form at will outside of full moons. The transformation lasts as long as desired and can be controlled. Non-lycanthropes gain +1 to Physique when facing beasts or werewolves.
special_ability.cost: Free action for lycanthropes, once per session
special_ability.limitation: Primary benefit only applies to lycanthropes

legendary_artifacts.requirements: None, but most powerful for lycanthropes
legendary_artifacts.lycanthropy_synergy: Allows complete control over werewolf transformations - can transform at will and maintain control
legendary_artifacts.corruption_risk: The ring hungers for the hunt. Can be compelled to seek worthy prey or engage in risky hunts.
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Mark of Hircine's favor. Werewolves recognize the ring's power. Can be given to Companion werewolves as a gift.

legendary_artifacts.name: The Masque of Clavicus Vile
legendary_artifacts.description: A face-mask that enhances the wearer's charm and persuasiveness.

special_ability.name: Irresistible Persuasion
special_ability.effect: Once per session, automatically succeed on a social check (Rapport, Deceive, or Provoke) regardless of opposition.

legendary_artifacts.requirements: Willingness to deal with Clavicus Vile
legendary_artifacts.corruption_risk: Clavicus Vile is god of bargains and trickery. Wearing his mask may lead to unwanted deals.
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: NPCs may notice the unsettling mask. Some are charmed, others deeply disturbed.

legendary_artifacts.name: Volendrung
legendary_artifacts.description: A massive warhammer that absorbs stamina from enemies.

special_ability.name: Stamina Drain
special_ability.effect: On successful hit, target loses 1 physical stress box AND you gain +1 to your next action.
special_ability.limitation: Works once per target per scene

legendary_artifacts.orc_synergy: Orcs show great respect to wielder of Malacath's artifact
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Orcs treat wielder with honor. Completing The Cursed Tribe quest highly respected.

legendary_artifacts.name: Spellbreaker
legendary_artifacts.description: A dwarven shield that can block magical attacks.

special_ability.name: Spell Ward
special_ability.effect: When using defend action against magical attack, gain +3 instead of +2. Can completely negate spell on success with style.

legendary_artifacts.story_impact: One of the best defensive items against mages. Highly valued by warriors facing spellcasters.

legendary_artifacts.name: Spear of Bitter Mercy
legendary_artifacts.location: Unknown — may be awarded during campaign
legendary_artifacts.description: A spear that hums with the Huntsman's will. It embodies the moment prey's struggle ends—mercy, delivered with finality.

mechanical_stats.base_bonus: +2 to Fight when wielding (when the spear's aspect is relevant)

special_ability.name: Bitter Mercy
special_ability.effect: When the spear helps you inflict a Mild Consequence, the target gains the situation aspect 'Bitter Mercy'. Until that target is taken out, your stress dealt to them counts as Weapon:1.
special_ability.cost: Narrative permission (spear must be the vector of the consequence).
special_ability.limitation: Level 1 dormant—full awakening tracked by clock.

legendary_artifacts.corruption_risk: Daedric influence. The spear can be compelled to demand worthy prey, risky timing, or merciless escalation.
legendary_artifacts.story_impact: Marks the wielder as Hircine-touched. Hunters fear/respect; Thalmor categorize as an anomaly; Companions take interest. At Level 4 awakening, the spear marks its wielder as an apex predator to beasts and lycanthropes.

power_levels.minor: +1 damage vs. frost-vulnerable enemies, creates 'Burning' aspect on critical hit
power_levels.moderate: +2 damage always, +1 stress over time for one exchange on hit
power_levels.major: +2 damage, create 'Ablaze' lasting aspect (1 stress per exchange) on targets

power_levels.minor: +1 damage vs. fire-vulnerable enemies, slows target (-1 to Athletics next exchange)
power_levels.moderate: +2 damage, creates 'Chilled' aspect reducing enemy speed
power_levels.major: +2 damage, create 'Frozen' aspect (target must overcome Fair +2 to move zones)

power_levels.minor: +1 damage, drains 1 mental stress from spellcasters
power_levels.moderate: +2 damage, prevents target from casting spells next exchange

weapon_enchantments.name: Soul Trap

power_levels.minor: On killing blow, capture soul in empty soul gem (requires gem equipped)
power_levels.moderate: Automatically captures souls, +1 to capturing higher quality souls
power_levels.major: Captures souls and provides +1 damage for each soul stored (max +3)

weapon_enchantments.mechanical_note: Captured souls used for enchanting or recharging enchanted items

power_levels.major: On hit, recover 2 stress and can downgrade one mild consequence
+2 to defend, can ignore first stress from that element per scene
+2 to skill, aspect 'Master of [Skill]' with one free invoke per session

power_levels.moderate: +2 to Stealth, movement makes no sound

jewelry_enchantments.name: Resist Magic
jewelry_enchantments.effect: +1 to +3 to defend against all magical attacks

requirements: Soul gems (power level determines enchantment strength)
Knowledge of enchantment (learned from disenchanting items)

process.step_1: Select item to enchant (weapon, armor, jewelry)
process.step_3: Select soul gem (determines power: petty=minor, grand=major)
process.step_4: Make Crafts check vs. difficulty (Fair +2 for minor, Great +4 for major)
process.step_5: On success, item gains enchantment. On failure, soul gem consumed but item unenchanted.

learning_enchantments.method: Disenchant magical items at enchanting table
learning_enchantments.mechanic: Destroy enchanted item permanently to learn its enchantment
learning_enchantments.benefit: Can then apply that enchantment to other items

finding_artifacts.quest_rewards: Major artifacts typically earned through completing faction or Daedric quests
finding_artifacts.dungeon_loot: Enchanted equipment found in boss chests, hidden areas, or quest locations
finding_artifacts.purchasing: Can buy minor enchanted items from court wizards and specialist merchants (expensive)
finding_artifacts.crafting: Players can create their own using enchanting system

limiting_power: Only one enchantment per item (Fate Core simplification)
Recharging: Enchanted weapons drain charge. Require soul gems to recharge after extended use.
Multiple items: Wearing multiple enchanted items is possible but GM may limit total bonuses to prevent power creep
Legendary uniqueness: Only one of each legendary artifact exists. If PC has it, no one else does.

suggested_limits.total_enchantment_bonus: GM may cap total skill bonuses from equipment at +3 to +4
suggested_limits.artifact_attunement: Optional rule: Can only benefit from 3-4 enchanted items at once. Must choose which to 'attune'
suggested_limits.rare_components: High-level enchanting requires rare components found in dangerous locations

story_integration.artifact_quests: Major artifacts should require significant quests to obtain, not just gold
story_integration.npc_reactions: NPCs react to visible artifacts (Daedric items cause fear, ancient Nord items inspire respect)
story_integration.faction_items: Some artifacts tied to specific factions (Companions, College, etc.)
story_integration.moral_choices: Daedric artifacts often require morally gray or evil acts to obtain
story_integration.consequences: Wielding certain artifacts has long-term story consequences (Daedric Prince attention, faction reactions)

design_tips: Give artifact a unique aspect that can be invoked
Special abilities should be powerful but limited (once per session, cost Fate Points)
Tie artifacts to story and character development
Balance power with drawbacks or costs
Make acquiring artifact a memorable story moment
